title: Moat-and-trees footer banner asset and page-bottom rendering

requirements.summary: Add a new castle-style decorative moat-and-trees footer banner graphic as a generated static asset sized for a bottom-of-page strip.
acceptanceCriteria: A new image file exists at frontend/public/assets/generated/moat-trees-footer-banner.dim_1600x300.png.
The graphic is purely visual (no embedded text) and reads well when cropped responsively across common screen widths.
The graphic’s style matches the existing hero banner aesthetic (similar palette/illustration style to /assets/generated/institution-hero-banner.dim_1600x600.png).

file_operations.description: Create the new decorative footer strip illustration (moat + trees), visually consistent with the existing castle hero banner style; ensure it is text-free and designed to crop well horizontally at common viewport widths.

requirements.summary: Render the moat-and-trees footer banner as a full-width bottom-of-page strip on all routed pages, positioned above the global footer and responsive without overlapping content.
acceptanceCriteria: Navigating to each route (e.g., Overview, Bio, Learning Outcomes, Takeaways, Activities, Slides, References, Movie References, Leadership Board) displays the moat/trees image as a bottom strip above the existing footer.
The image does not overlap page content and remains responsive (full width, fixed height or max-height, with appropriate object-fit).
No backend changes are required for this feature.

file_operations.description: Insert a full-width decorative image strip immediately above the existing global <footer>, using the static asset frontend/public/assets/generated/moat-trees-footer-banner.dim_1600x300.png; ensure layout keeps it at the bottom of each page’s content area (within the flex column shell), with responsive sizing (fixed height or max-height) and object-fit so it does not overlap the routed page content.
